page.title: 01BRIDGE OF WEIR - SOUTH WEST
page.content: Most of the land in this block lies above above 76m with a few high points up to 165m.The land is mainly used for {dairy farming.} The small town of{Bridge of Weir}- population circa 7,000 - is situated in the North West corner of the block and straddles the{River Gryffe.}A high percentage of the people work in the{nearbye city of Glasgow}or in neighbouring towns. Most people own their own houses and these are attractively built on a steep hillside on one side of the Gryffe. Others live in pleasant houses rented from the District Council. There is very little{industry}in the area but there are two leather works which are the only remaining evidence of small industries including cotton mills which flourished along the Gryffe in the early 19th century.
